e17-4yp-3D-Occupancy-Prediction-for-Auto.title: 3D Occupancy Prediction for Autonomous Driving
e17-4yp-3D-Occupancy-Prediction-for-Auto.description: 3D scene understanding and reasoning is crucial for a vision-based autonomous driving model. In this work, we mainly focus on building an End-to-End autonomous driving architecture with 3D occupancy prediction that'll help downstream vision and driving tasks.

e17-4yp-Acceleration-of-deep-neural-netw.title: Acceleration of deep neural network based nanopore super accuracy basecalling
e17-4yp-Acceleration-of-deep-neural-netw.description: Implementing suitable acceleration to speed up nanopore super accuracy basecalling process.

e17-4yp-Applying-deep-learning-on-histol.title: Applying deep learning on histological images of lymph tissues
e17-4yp-Applying-deep-learning-on-histol.description: Automated LN image analysis project aims to alleviate the demand on histologists, leading to earlier cancer detection and saving lives.

e17-4yp-Comparative-Analysis-of-2nd-and-.title: Comparative Analysis of 2nd and 3rd Generation Sequencing
e17-4yp-Comparative-Analysis-of-2nd-and-.description: The main objective of this project is to do a comparative analysis of the 2nd and 3rd generation sequencing methods to optimize the cost and efficiency.

e17-4yp-Comprehensive-ECG-analysis-with-.title: Comprehensive ECG analysis with Deep Learning on GPU accelerators
e17-4yp-Comprehensive-ECG-analysis-with-.description: Objective: Developing a GPU accelerated Deep Learning algorithm for ECG analysis which works like the MUSE ECG system and optimizing it as an open-source, portable, and low-power GPU alternative, capable of providing comprehensive analysis.

e17-4yp-Deep-Learning-for-Side-Channel-A.title: Deep Learning for Side Channel Attacks
e17-4yp-Deep-Learning-for-Side-Channel-A.description: Investigating Machine Learning-based Attacks on Random Frequency Tuning-based Countermeasures

e17-4yp-Human-Emotion-Detection-with-Ele.title: Human Emotion Detection with Electrocardiographic  Electroencephelographic and Other Signals
e17-4yp-Human-Emotion-Detection-with-Ele.description: Human emotion detection with electrocardiographic, electroencephalographic and other signals using machine learning techniques

e17-4yp-Improving-Trajectory-Guided-Cont.title: Improving Trajectory Guided Control Prediction for Autonomous Driving
e17-4yp-Improving-Trajectory-Guided-Cont.description: In this project we first are trying to identify the issues in the TCP architecture and to improve its accuracy. Carla Simulator will be used to test the accuracy of our models.

e17-4yp-Investigating-Onchip-Sensor-Base.title: Investigating Onchip Sensor Based RPA Attack Vulnerabilities of Light Weight Ciphers
e17-4yp-Investigating-Onchip-Sensor-Base.description: At the moment there are some proven Correlation Power Analysis attacks against AES cipher with help of on-chip sensors and machine learning techniques. The aim of this research project is to investigate other ciphers for Remote Power Analysis Attacks and propose countermeasures to prevent RPA attacks on those ciphers.

e17-4yp-Large-Language-Models-in-Educati.title: Large Language Models in Education
e17-4yp-Large-Language-Models-in-Educati.description: The project targets to explore the use of Large Language models in education and develop an intelligent tutor.

e17-4yp-Low-Complexity-Algorithm-for-Arr.title: Low Complexity Algorithm for Arrhythmia Detection

e17-4yp-Music-Emotion-Recognition.title: Music Emotion Recognition
e17-4yp-Music-Emotion-Recognition.description: Music plays a major role in our day-to-day life, as it can ease our tense life. In modern society, people can have access to music via networks and electronic products. Emotion is one of the most crucial components of music and it has an enormous significance in real-world applications that include massive music data management, personalized music

e17-4yp-Neuromorphic-NoC-Architecture-fo.title: Neuromorphic NoC Architecture for SNNs
e17-4yp-Neuromorphic-NoC-Architecture-fo.description: This project aims to develop a novel neuromorphic NoC architecture based on RISC-V ISA to support spiking neural network applications, and test it on FPGA.

e17-4yp-OCR-and-Translation-from-Sinhala.title: OCR and Translation from Sinhala to Tamil for Printed Documents
e17-4yp-OCR-and-Translation-from-Sinhala.description: The project aims to create an OCR-based software that recognizes printed Sinhala text, converts it to editable format, and then translates it to Tamil. This application utilizes OCR technology for text conversion and employs machine translation algorithms for Sinhala-to-Tamil translation.

e17-4yp-Virtual-Patient-Simulator-for-Sk.title: Virtual Patient Simulator for Skill Training in Dentistry

e17-4yp-develop-a-programming-and-compil.title: develop a programming and compiler toolchain for multi agent systems
e17-4yp-develop-a-programming-and-compil.description: The aim is to design an Integrated Development Environment to build software for multi-agent systems. The IDE shall provide facilities to compose algorithms at a high-level (ideally in a visual manner), and compile them over multiple stages into binaries and program the hardware over-the-air (OTA).

e17-4yp-flexible-glove-for-real-time-tra.title: flexible glove for real time tracking and analysis of hand and finger movements
e17-4yp-flexible-glove-for-real-time-tra.description: This research proposes a flexible glove embedded with 9-axis IMUs for real-time tracking and analysis of hand movements, revolutionizing remote training in various fields.

e17-4yp-novel-compression-methods-for-na.title: novel compression methods for nanopore raw signal data

e17-4yp-os-initiated-cache-switching-to-.title: os initiated cache switching to minimize performance loss in context switches
e17-4yp-os-initiated-cache-switching-to-.description: OS-initiated cache switching to minimize performance loss in context switches

e17-4yp-using-machine-learning-in-high-s.title: using machine learning in high stake settings
e17-4yp-using-machine-learning-in-high-s.description: Explainability becomes crucial in most real-world settings where ML models are used to make decisions. ML models taking decisions in these settings require to have their decisions explained to identify possible existing biases, proof of non-discrimination, to identify counterfactuals, and due to safety concerns.
